ranges.notes: New Year's Day (Jan 1) is a public holiday. Three Kings celebration (Jan 5-6) features a spectacular parade and gift-giving tradition. January 6 is a public holiday.
Traditional opening of cider season in nearby cider houses (sagardotegis) with special menus and cider-pouring rituals
Winter sales begin, fewer tourists, cold but typically milder than northern Europe, excellent time for museum visits like the Guggenheim and Fine Arts Museum
Low season with fewer tourists, good value accommodations, perfect for museum visits and pintxo crawls without crowds
Special menus at restaurants, romantic dining opportunities with views of the illuminated Guggenheim
Colorful celebration with parades, costumes, and festivities throughout the city, especially in the Old Town (Casco Viejo)
Early spring with improving weather, almond blossoms in surrounding countryside, fewer tourists than high season

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Major religious festival with processions through the Old Town, traditional music, and special cultural events
If Easter falls in April, Holy Week processions continue with major events on Holy Thursday and Good Friday
Spring weather establishes, ideal for exploring both city and countryside, excellent time for Basque coastal towns and spring cuisine
Public holiday with demonstrations and events throughout the city
Special tours and events highlighting Bilbao's architectural renaissance, including behind-the-scenes access to notable buildings
Early summer with excellent weather, perfect for combining city exploration with nearby beaches like Sopelana and Plentzia
Midsummer celebration with bonfires on nearby beaches, traditional dances, and festivities on June 23-24
Major international music festival held on Mount Cobetas overlooking the city, featuring global music stars and camping options
Peak summer season with warm temperatures, good time for exploring Bilbao's riverfront and taking day trips to coastal towns
Peak tourist season with many locals on vacation, some businesses may close, excellent beach weather
Bilbao's massive nine-day festival with concerts, traditional sports, fireworks, bullfights, and street performances throughout the city
The Great Week festival may continue into early September depending on the calendar
Excellent weather continues with fewer tourists than August, perfect time to explore the city and nearby wine regions
Comfortable autumn temperatures, fall colors in surrounding mountains, excellent for hiking and cultural activities
National holiday with events and celebrations throughout the city
Contemporary music festival and industry conference featuring international artists at the BEC venue
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services
Quieter tourism period, cooler weather, excellent for museum visits and gastronomic experiences
Prestigious film festival showcasing documentaries and short films at venues throughout the city
Public holidays on December 6 (Constitution) and December 8 (Immaculate Conception) with special events
Christmas markets and decorations throughout the city, festive atmosphere at Plaza Nueva and Gran Vía
Traditional Basque market celebrating rural traditions with txistorra sausage, artisanal products, and cultural displays
Shopping period before Christmas, traditional Olentzero (Basque Santa) appearances
Public holiday with limited opening hours, family-focused celebration
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere, winter sales begin
Celebrations throughout the city, particularly in Plaza Nueva and around the Guggenheim, with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight

spring: Mount Artxanda Funicular Rides for City Views
Flores en la Ría Festival Along the Riverside
Semana Santa Processions in Casco Viejo
Athletic Club Football Matches at San Mamés
Day Trips to Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve
Spring Lamb Dishes at Traditional Restaurants
summer: Beaches at Getxo, Sopelana, and Plentzia
Rooftop Dining with Views of the Guggenheim
autumn: Mushroom Foraging Day Trips with Guides
Autumn Colors in Gorbea Natural Park
Chestnut and Cider Season Gastronomic Events
winter: Three Kings Parade in City Center
Santo Tomás Market at Plaza Nueva
Day Trips to Nearby Ski Resorts
New Year's Eve Celebrations in Plaza Nueva

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
